RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ENGLISH BAY TEDDY away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch, opened a clear lead entering the final turn, and widened his advantage through the lane while being ridden out late. BARBERRY BANDIT tracked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and while no threat to the winner, finished willingly two wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. SOMTHING ELUSIVE broke sharply and stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing three out from the rail, continued from the outside while rallying three wide entering the final turn, and finished two out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. TEXAS MOONSHINE unhurried early while settling at the back of the pack entering the backstretch, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished with late interest from along the rail in the drive. SHOWMAN away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Moonshine
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Barberry Bandit
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: English Bay Teddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, clear lead, widened, ridden out

ENTRY.NAME: Somthing Elusive
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 4 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Showman
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 3 wide, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Maiden Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000, if for $45,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $57,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WICKED NIGHT broke sharply and tracked the leader in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, collared the leader while commencing a two wide bid entering the final turn, took command midway through the turn, and held DESIRED OUTCOME safely at bay late to prove best. DESIRED OUTCOME stalked the pacesetter into the backstretch while saving ground along the inside entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly one out from the rail in the drive to prove second best. STANFORD NORTH away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch, was collared by WICKED NIGHT entering the final turn while saving ground at the rail, was overtaken midway through the turn, and finished from along the inside in the drive to prove best of the rest. EMPEROROFTHENORTH stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn but was unable to mount a late bid while finishing four wide in the drive. MS. STANFORD unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, was always well back and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Stanford North
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Emperorofthenorth
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Desired Outcome
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Night
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2w, rallied 2w, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Ms. Stanford
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, never menaced

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 9 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Ra ce Since May 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BARNEY GOOGLE unhurried early while dropping back to trail, rallied smartly four wide entering the final turn, assumed command leaving the turn, and drew clear in the lane. YOU DON'T OWN ME stalked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, advanced smartly four wide midway down the backstretch and took command soon after entering the final turn, was quickly tackled by BARNEY GOOGLE leaving the turn, and while no match for that rival, finished willingly to prove second best. LIZZIES GIRL tracked the dueling leaders through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, maintained her position in the run down the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, while awaiting racing room, shifted two wide for the drive and finished with late interest to get up for a share. KNOPFLER away well and tracked the leaders one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, held his position in the run down the backstretch, rallied three wide approaching the final turn, steadied when losing his path entering the turn, and finished three wide in the drive. CERTIFIABLE away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of CALAMAZEUS through the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch, but weakened over the final furlong. CALAMAZEUS broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and into the final turn, but faded in the late stages.

ENTRY.NAME: Lizzies Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Calamazeus
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Certifiable
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Knopfler
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 w, rallied 3w, steadied 1/4, closed 3 w

ENTRY.NAME: You Don't Own Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, advanced 3/8, rallied 3 wide, led, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Barney Google
ENTRY.OWNER: Roberts-Henson Michelle Henson Brad Henson Randy Henson Dan and Irwin Trevor
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 4 wide, led, drew clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 8 Allowed 2 lbs. ; Such A Race Since May 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pri ce $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs.3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). BC Bred Claiming Price $5,000.

CLAIM.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing No Trump Stable Bill Breen Racing and Elder Matt

RACE.FOOTNOTES: FILLY FATALE rushed to a clear lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, held a narrow advantage into the lane, and inched clear late. TUXEDO stalked the leader into the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, was unable to match strides with FILLY FATALE entering the lane, but finished three wide in the drive to prove second best. STOPSHOPPINGSHELLY settled well off the early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, launched her bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished five wide in the drive with late interest to get up for a share. SILVER ARROW hopped at the start, and trailed the field into the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, jumped shadows approaching the wire the first time while causing her rider to lose his outside iron for a few steps, advanced into a striking position midway down the backside, and finished from along the rail in the drive. CHAMPIOSA stalked the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. EH TEE EM settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the lane the first time, maintained his position into the backstretch, began to struggle to keep up in the run to the final turn, and had little to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Champiosa
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Stopshoppingshelly
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Eh Tee Em
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Arrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: hop start, trailed, jump shadows, lost irons, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Tuxedo
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2w, pressed 2w, rallied 2w, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Filly Fatale
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, rallied inside, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 51. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLACKSTONE away alertly, and rushed to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, held a clear advantage into the final turn, and was never seriously threatened at any point. DEANARROW stalked the pacesetter from along the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive to hold the place. SHE'S ON FIRE away well and tracked the leader into the backside while racing one out from the rail, commenced her bid two wide entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive to garner a share. UNION MAN settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied with interest three wide entering the final turn, and closed four wide in the drive in an even effort. MEMORANDUM settled off the early pace while saving ground along the inside entering the backstretch, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. BEST ONE YET unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, rallied two wide from the back of the pack entering he final turn, but failed to make a late impact. MILO'S COMMAND broke sharply and was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing three wide into the backstretch, continued with a wide trip throughout, and steadily retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: Deanarrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Memorandum
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied rail, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: She's On Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Blackstone
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, clear lead, held

ENTRY.NAME: Union Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Milo's Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled 3 wide, steady retreat

ENTRY.NAME: Best One Yet
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, never menaced

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,00 0 To $6,000 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming $10,000, Three Year Old $12,000 (BC Bred $15,000). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DEPUTY'S DANCER away well and settled off the pacesetter while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, quickly overhauled the pacesetter soon after straightening for home, and drew clear. BETTER TONE unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, commenced his bid from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed willingly from along the rail in the drive. DYNAMITER settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and closed three wide in the drive to garner a share. RIMFIRE lagged well off the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. MONTE away alertly and sprinted to a clear lead in the run to the first turn, widened his advantage through the first turn, and maintained a massive lead in the run down the backstretch, continued with a clear advantage through the final turn, was quickly overhauled shortly after entering the lane, and tired badly in the late stages. JERSEYS IMAGE broke sharply and was allowed to settle off the early speedster, began to drop back in the run to the final turn, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Deputy's Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Dynamiter
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Jerseys Image
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled 2 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Rimfire
ENTRY.OWNER: Anderson, Dr. Bryan C. and Carol
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Better Tone
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Monte
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, clear lead, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO $5,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED AT THE 2023 MEET AND HAVE NOT FINISHED 1ST, 2ND OR 3RD AT THE CURRENT MEET. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. (Horse s that win this condition are no longer eligible for this condition while all other starters in this condition remain eligible.)(Winning this race will not be considered in eligibility in any other condition maidens excluded). British Columbia Bred Claimi ng Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PADDY D'ORO broke sharply and stalked the early pace while saving ground at the rail in the run down the backside, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, and closed determinedly two wide from between rivals in deep stretch to get up in time. ACE DEUCE away alertly and was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering he backstretch, rallied two wide through the final turn, shifted three wide entering the lane, and closed willingly to just miss. IT'S IN COMMAND away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering he backstretch, dictated the pace in the run down the backside and through the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive and just failed to last. VANCOUVER'S HUNTER stalked the early pace while racing two wide entering the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive. BODEGA unhurried early while dropping back to trail, rallied one out from the rail entering the final turn, and finished with late interest two wide in the drive. VALUE MAX tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but faded in the late stages while finishing at the rail in the drive. ANOTHER GUINNESS stalked the early pace while racing three wide into the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong. TIMELESS SHRUG settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backside, was always well back and showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Paddy d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalk rail, rallied inside, closed 2w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Value Max
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: It's in Command
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Vancouver's Hunter
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Ace Deuce
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Another Guinness
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Timeless Shrug
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Bodega
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E and Doyle Maurice
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,
